metadata.synopsis: AOM and OOM for Lae'zel at Knights of the Shield. The Githyanki Inquisitor will talk to players and, in the end, attack them.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter Knights of the Shield and be spotted by any of the Githyanki there.

14.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
14.text: Lae'zel. So you decided to make your appearance.

41.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
41.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Stand down! It is on our Queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

56.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
56.text: The Undying Queen cares not for who delivers her the Prism and the traitor prince within.

35.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
35.text: All that matters is that it is delivered.

69.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
69.text: The false heir's head will make a fine trophy for Vlaakith. As for you -

15.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
15.text: - I will leave nothing behind but meat and shattered bone.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her only gift to you.

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: Strike me and die - a failed warrior forgotten by our people.

51.speaker: Lae'zel
51.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

24.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

34.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
34.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

80.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
80.text: I know exactly what the Prism contains. The traitor prince who would hand us to ghaik.

67.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
67.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

53.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
53.text: The kith'raki have spread word of that artefact that you carry.

59.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
59.text: An artefact our venerable queen would stop at nothing to take back.

5.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
5.text: Tell me, Lae'zel of K'liir. What reward do you think the Astral Prism will fetch once I pluck it from your corpse and present it to Vlaakith?

47.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
47.text: What honours, what riches, will the Undying Queen grant me when I hand her the failed prince?
47.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.
1.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.
23.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.
17.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

57.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
57.text: Damnable whelp. For a thousand years have I given my life to Vlaakith.
57.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

68.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
68.text: Damnable whelp. For a thousand years have I given my life to Vlaakith.
68.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

3.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
3.text: And you - this child, this unascended - would snatch my glory for yourself.
3.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

25.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
25.text: You may keep your head. But I will yet be exalted. I will yet see my name carved in slate.
25.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

20.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
20.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

44.text: I will deliver to her the Prince of the Comet. She shall exalt me. The gish will record my great deed in slate!

39.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
39.text: I will deliver to her the Prince of the Comet. She shall exalt me. The gish will record my great deed in slate!

52.speaker: Lae'zel
52.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

32.text: I will remember you said that.

70.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
70.text: I was not asking for it. Htak'a!

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: This artefact contains our people's future. I won't let you take it.

40.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
40.text: Dearest Lae'zel. You've fallen victim to a manipulation. The traitor prince would lead us to ruin.

61.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
61.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism and restore it to our queen.

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: You cannot best me. You will die here, and your legacy will die with you.

75.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
75.text: The traitor prince will be the fall of the githyanki.

4.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
4.text: Vlaakith will not have your head today. But have it, she will.

38.text: Gith's wretched son will be the fall of the githyanki.

27.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
27.text: Gith's wretched son will be the fall of the githyanki.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

76.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
76.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargaz, then Lae'zel

78.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
78.text: I'm told you carry an artefact most cherished.
